body:
There are 3 Linux specific dependencies:

1. the [RDMA user space libraries](https://github.com/linux-rdma/rdma-core), co-evolving with all [kernel drivers](https://github.com/torvalds/linux/tree/master/drivers/infiniband) in Linux source tree
2. the [nv_peer_mem](https://github.com/Mellanox/nv_peer_memory) Linux kernel module, developed by Menallox and NVIDIA using their [kernel APIs](http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/gpudirect-rdma/index.html#kernel-api)
3. detection of numa node of IB device using `/proc`, as similar to [what is being done for CUDA device](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/45254d9d7f790f97746775967637773d137682a9/tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc#L899)

Being said that, I agree with you that a partial fix could be introduced in the same way as it is handled in #5991.
